document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Theopea Baly (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) of East Asia: species lacking modified clypeus in males and the T. sauteri species group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Theopea Baly (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) of East Asia: species lacking modified clypeus in males and the T. sauteri species group

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types.
Lectotype ♂ ( TARI ), here designated, labeled: “LOO-CHOO / IRIOMOTE /
V-1932
/ S. Hirayama [p, w] / / CO / Type [p, circle label with yellow letters and border] // Theopea / aureoviridis / CHÛJÔ [h] / DET. M. CHUJO [p, w] // 1642 [p, w]”
.
Paralectotypes : 5♂♂ , 7♀♀ ( TARI ), same data as lectotype, but with “1643, 1737, 1738, or
2299–2307
”
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Theopea aureoviridis
adults are similar to those of
T. collaris
in color and presence of extremely coarse punctures on the elytra. They can be distinguished by the absence of longitudinal ridges on the elytra and the metallic green vertex and pronotum ( Figs 2 A–2C) (distinct longitudinal ridges on the elytra and the yellowish brown vertex and pronotum in
T. collaris
( Figs 2 D–2H)). Males of
T. aureoviridis
have bifurcate apices of the penis and a single hook-like dorsal sclerite ( Figs 3 C–3F) which shared with most of Taiwanese species, but
T. collaris
is characterized by the truncate, oblique apex of the penis and paired dorsal sclerites ( Figs 7 C–7F).
Distribution. Japan : Ryukyus ( Okinawa , Iriomote, and Ishigaki islands).
